values.description:
We (Open Robotics), have received a request to use a `metadata.pbtxt` file as an alternative to `model.config` for Fuel resources.

The benefit are:

1. A well-defined format, as opposed to a loosely defined XML format.
2. Ability to serialize and transmit meta data over the wire.
3. Easily convert this data to JSON for use with other REST APIs and services like ElasticSearch. 

The near-term consumer of these messages is only the `ign-fuel-tools` library. The CLI offered by ign-fuel-tools will be extended to upload models. During upload, the `ign-fuel-tools` library will read either a `metadata.txt` file, using the format defined here, or the `model.config` file.

See #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-fuel-tools/pull-requests/108, which uses the messages in this PR.
values.title: [Citadel] Fuel resource metadata, which can be used instead of 'model.config'

3. Easily convert this data to JSON for use with other REST APIs and services like ElasticSearch. 

The near-term consumer of these messages is only the `ign-fuel-tools` library. The CLI offered by ign-fuel-tools will be extended to upload models. During upload, the `ign-fuel-tools` library will read either a `metadata.txt` file, using the format defined here, or the `model.config` file.

See #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-fuel-tools/pull-requests/108, which uses the messages in this PR.
summary.html:
We (Open Robotics), have received a request to use a metadata.pbtxt file as an alternative to model.config for Fuel resources.

The benefit are:

  1. A well-defined format, as opposed to a loosely defined XML format.
  2. Ability to serialize and transmit meta data over the wire.
  3. Easily convert this data to JSON for use with other REST APIs and services like ElasticSearch.

The near-term consumer of these messages is only the ign-fuel-tools library. The CLI offered by ign-fuel-tools will be extended to upload models. During upload, the ign-fuel-tools library will read either a metadata.txt file, using the format defined here, or the model.config file.

See #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-fuel-tools/pull-requests/108, which uses the messages in this PR.

values.description: Remove `use_parent_model_frame` and replace with `xyz_expressed_in`. We're still considering whether `msgs::Pose` should contain frame information or if another message type should be created containing pose and frame information.
values.title: [Citadel] [WIP] Add support for sdformat frame semantics

values.description: This addresses #35 by deprecating all `double` fields in joint_cmd.proto and pid.proto and replacing with `Double` fields, which will be optional.
values.title: [Citadel]:deprecate all double fields in joint_cmd and pid, replace with Double

summary.html: This addresses #35 by deprecating all double fields in joint_cmd.proto and pid.proto and replacing with Double fields, which will be optional.

values.description:
On pull request #86, I said:

> gazebo_ros_pkgs also has a reference_frame option for the pose which I didn't add here because the implementation can be a bit involved (frame has to exist, calculate the relative pose...), so I feel that it's the kind of thing that the user of the service should be handling instead, but I can be convinced otherwise (and I can implement it for ign-gazebo in that case).

While migrating some code from Gazebo to Ignition, I convinced myself otherwise.

It's good it all aligned with the advent of SDF frame semantics, so now I can follow the new convention and name the field `relative_to`, instead of `reference_frame`.

I'll work on the `ign-gazebo` PR soon, but unlike this one, that one doesn't need to be rushed to get into Citadel because it shouldn't break ABI.
values.title: [Citadel] Factory relative to

summary.raw:
On pull request #86, I said:

> gazebo_ros_pkgs also has a reference_frame option for the pose which I didn't add here because the implementation can be a bit involved (frame has to exist, calculate the relative pose...), so I feel that it's the kind of thing that the user of the service should be handling instead, but I can be convinced otherwise (and I can implement it for ign-gazebo in that case).

While migrating some code from Gazebo to Ignition, I convinced myself otherwise.

It's good it all aligned with the advent of SDF frame semantics, so now I can follow the new convention and name the field `relative_to`, instead of `reference_frame`.

I'll work on the `ign-gazebo` PR soon, but unlike this one, that one doesn't need to be rushed to get into Citadel because it shouldn't break ABI.
summary.html:
On pull request #86, I said:

gazebo_ros_pkgs also has a reference_frame option for the pose which I didn't add here because the implementation can be a bit involved (frame has to exist, calculate the relative pose...), so I feel that it's the kind of thing that the user of the service should be handling instead, but I can be convinced otherwise (and I can implement it for ign-gazebo in that case).

While migrating some code from Gazebo to Ignition, I convinced myself otherwise.

It's good it all aligned with the advent of SDF frame semantics, so now I can follow the new convention and name the field relative_to, instead of reference_frame.

I'll work on the ign-gazebo PR soon, but unlike this one, that one doesn't need to be rushed to get into Citadel because it shouldn't break ABI.

values.description:
While updating osrf/gazebo to use ign-msgs5, I noticed that the CameraSensor needs to convert a pixel format from a string to `ignition::msgs::PixelFormatType`, so I've added `ConvertPixelFormatType` helper functions to `Utility.hh`.

This change would be helpful for the upcoming gazebo release, so I've bumped the version to 5.1.0 in anticipation of releasing this change.
values.title: Add ConvertPixelFormatType functions to Utility.hh

summary.raw:
While updating osrf/gazebo to use ign-msgs5, I noticed that the CameraSensor needs to convert a pixel format from a string to `ignition::msgs::PixelFormatType`, so I've added `ConvertPixelFormatType` helper functions to `Utility.hh`.

This change would be helpful for the upcoming gazebo release, so I've bumped the version to 5.1.0 in anticipation of releasing this change.
summary.html:
While updating osrf/gazebo to use ign-msgs5, I noticed that the CameraSensor needs to convert a pixel format from a string to ignition::msgs::PixelFormatType, so I've added ConvertPixelFormatType helper functions to Utility.hh.

This change would be helpful for the upcoming gazebo release, so I've bumped the version to 5.1.0 in anticipation of releasing this change.

values.description:
Backporting [these changes](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/157/citadel-fuel-resource-metadata-which-can/diff#chg-src/Generator.cc) to prevent [these warnings](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_msgs-ci-ign-msgs4-homebrew-amd64/18/warnings10Result/), i.e.

~~~
image.pb.cc:339, Clang (LLVM based), Priority: Normal

'pixel_format' is deprecated
~~~
values.title: Ignore deprecation warnings on generated code
